item.description:
Top of the Hub is a great place to wind down on a Friday evening, with a few sundowners and some awesome live jazz.

The view from one of the tallest buildings in town is spectacular (unless it's foggy!!), you really feel like you are on top of the world. Bring a camera if you're into urban sunset scenes.

The "lounge" food menu is very good and reasonably priced. Most appetizers are close to meal-size.They do have a minimum spend requirement after 8pm (when the jazz band starts) of $24 per head - but that's not much when you consider that a cocktail/mixed drink is close to $10, or more than $10 when you do the fancy cocktails. .

We're meeting at 7pm, well before the minimum spend requirement starts, so will probably have already achieved it by then!!

See Top of the Hub for directions and more info including list of who's playing.

**** VERY IMPORTANT ****
There is virtually zero cellphone reception at Top of the Hub, due to all the reinforced concrete of the structure!!

We will do our best to let the hostess know where we are in case people ask where our group is, but that is not always 100% reliable.

So as far as finding the group goes, you may well have to walk thru the lounge until you spot a face or faces that you recognize. We're joining another Boston social group for this event, so we should be a group of close to 20 people, possibly more, so it shouldn't be too difficult to find us.

FYI: The Prudential Center garage has validated parking for Top of the Hub. Get the hostess to stamp your parking ticket.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the lounge area to the right of the bar.
item.name: Friday Sundowners, Jazz and more @ Top of the Hub
